sub_title: IBM - Global Methodology Lead for SAP
summary: Currently, I am working in IBM's Global Business Services in our SAP Practice. I operate as a Project and Integration Manager in SAP Impact Industry Solutions. I serve a dual role as a Delivery Manager at our Baton Rouge’s Client Innovation Center. Between the two, I specialize in Tools, Methodology, and Project Management. On IMPACT, I manage employees in building industry solution accelerators and core assets within our Cross Industry Solution. This covers the standard range of ERP implementations across all major business modules. I also oversee solutions beyond the S4 Hana core to include cloud applications like Ariba, IBP, C4, GRC, etc. I have worked between agile and Waterfall Methodologies and helped lead the team to successfully generate accelerators for all S4 implementations globally. I'm also heavily invested in the sales and solutioning of projects using IMPACT and Enhanced Project Launch services. At BatonRouge, I oversee Program Tools, Methodology, and Project Management roles for ourSAP Delivery Practice.

awards.title: Combat Action Ribbon
awards.description: The Combat Action Ribbon (CAR) is a personal decoration of the United States Department of the Navy and U.S. Coast Guard that may be awarded to those who, in any grade including and below that of a Captain in the U.S. Navy and U.S. Coast Guard (or Colonel in the U.S. Marine Corps), have actively participated in ground or surface combat.

awards.title: Global War on Terrorism Service Medal
awards.description: To receive the Global War on Terrorism Service Medal, a military service member must perform duty in a designated anti-terrorism operation for a period of either 30 consecutive or 60 non-consecutive days of duty. For those who were engaged in combat, killed, or wounded in the line of duty the time requirement is waived

awards.title: Iraq Campaign Medal
awards.description: Eligibility for the ICM requires service members to have served in direct support of Operation Iraqi Freedom (OIF). The period of eligibility is on or after March 19, 2003 to a future date to be determined by the Secretary of Defense or the cessation of OIF.

awards.title: Marine Corps Good Conduct Medal
awards.description: he criteria for a Good Conduct Medal is defined by Executive Orders 8809, 9323, and 10444. The medal is awarded to any active-duty enlisted member of the United States military who completes three consecutive years of "honorable and faithful service". Such service implies that a standard enlistment was completed without any non-judicial punishment, disciplinary infractions, or court martial offenses. If a service member commits an offense, the three-year mark "resets" and a service member must perform an additional three years of service without having to be disciplined, before the Good Conduct may be authorized.

awards.title: NATO medal - ISAF Afghanistan
awards.description: Personnel eligible for this award are those member of units or staffs as set out in the Joint Operations Area (JOA) Combined Joint Statement of Requirements taking part in NATO operations in Afghanistan in accordance with the qualifying conditions. Entitlement will be acquired by those forces under NATO command or control while in the JOA, and those deployed to the JOA under national command in support of the NATO operation.

awards.title: Sea Service Deployment Ribbon
awards.description: The Sea Service Deployment Ribbon is granted to any member of the U.S. Navy or U.S. Marine Corps assigned to a deployable unit (e.g., a ship (including submarines), aircraft squadron, air wing or air group, detachment, battalion, Marine Expeditionary Unit, Marine Air Ground Task Force, or other unit type that operates away from its assigned homeport) and is forward-deployed for a period of either 90 consecutive days or two periods of at least 80 days each within a given 12-month period; or 6 months stationed overseas in a forward deployed location. Staffs of embarked Destroyer Squadrons (DESRONs), Amphibious Squadrons (PHIBRONs), Amphibious Readiness Groups (ARG), Expeditionary Strike Groups (ESGs), Carrier Strike Groups (CSGs) and similar units deployed within time period requirements are also eligible for award

profile_positions.description:
EPL JumpStart Core Member
Working to create packaged solutions for upcoming/existing clients in SAP and other ERP systems
•Assisting in the organization and creation of over 120 deliverables, ranging from Method Adoption Workshops to Organization Change Strategies. We worked with the Jumpstart team that existed previously to update and add deliverables that would help shorten Blueprinting for Projects.
•Tools Deployment Advisor responsible for the deployment, training, and administration of multiple tools recommended by IBM for SAP Implementations.
•Worked with clients ether as an EPL member or Impact lead including: TCI, SAAQ, CTE, Cleco, Arizona Beverages, Apotex, etc. 
•Lectured at breakaway sessions at the CAI EA 2017 convention
•Traveled to Halifax, Canada and hosted a three day course to train new CA EPL team. 

Tools and Methods Lead

-Lead in the creation of curriculums and training materials for the five tools associated with Impact’s philosophies. 
•	Blueworks Live
•	Solution Manager
•	Worksoft Certify
•	Workforce Performance Builder. 
•	IPWC
•	Jira

-Tasked with the Training and development of Tool Advisors.

Impact Lead

-Lead/Assisted in the development of Impact’s Blueworks Live Solution. 200 + PDDs and their future Industry specific development.
-Lead/Assisted in the creations of Impact’s BPH within Solution Manager
-Assisted in the development of the 1511/1610 BPP's in Workforce Performance Builder. Occasionally holding a lead position. 
• Lead in organizing the recording, editing, and functional reviews of processes across SAP Functional Streams.: Order to cash, PTP, PTM, Analytics, RTR, HR Connectivity, SuccessFactors, Hybris, SRM, CRM

profile_positions.title: Tool Advisor

profile_positions.description:
BluePrinting:
Create Global Questionairs for over 70 foreign elements
Used this information and contributed to the creation of multiple matrix, mapping documents, data sheets, and the early formation of the Master BPML
Creation of documents including WRICEF Trackers, GAP Analysis, Requirement Lists, Company Code Scopes, AR BPML Master, Global KDDs, Payment Methods Global Matrix, Policy and Process Standardization, Configuration Items, Report trackers, etc.

In the specific creation of PDDs, my duties were primary concentrated, but not limited, the following duties:
•	Assisted in the Creation of Business Process Master Lists up to Level 5 processes
•	Assisted in Process Design
•	Created Process Flows and corresponding Process Steps for all Lvl 4 and and Lvl 5 processes.
•	Assisted in establishing Requirements, GAPs and WRICEFs
•	Assisted in recognizing the required Reports, Policies, Chart of Account Considerations, and Forms needed for each level 4 process
•       Assisted in recognizing Organizational Change Impacts.

Configuration Documents:
•	Collecting, sorting, and analyzing data essential to the creation of Configuration Specification Documents.
•	Formatted FSs
•	Established Configuration Rational
•	Established Configuration Details
•	Documented Supporting Documentation

Functional Specs:

•	Collecting, sorting, and analyzing data essential to the creation of Functional Specifications.
•	Formatted FSs
•	General Information creation
•	Established Business Justification and Requirements
•	Assisted in the creation of testing scenarios
KBE:
Creation and development of KBEs ranged from initial template creation to data input during actual testing. The team met over the course of weeks to isolate testing scenarios from PDDs and format data sheets that would be used during testing.
Testing:
•	Testing of over 700 individual cases in multiple company codes and across numerous testing scenarios. 
•	Familiar with RQM, Certify for Automation, JIRA for Testing Defects.
